sorular.soru: How do you improve traffic flow in a traffic jam?
cevaplar: By always switching to the fastest-moving lane.
By staying in the same lane as much as possible.
sorular.dogruCevap: By staying in the same lane as much as possible.

feedback.metin: In a traffic jam, you can improve traffic flow by changing lanes as little as possible, because every change of lane means that other traffic is required to brake. In addition, you try to maintain a wide following distance and use this following distance to let the car roll out when the traffic in front of you brakes, to ensure that you yourself must brake as little as possible and can drive as constantly as possible.

sorular.soru: At what point in this situation should you indicate to the right?
cevaplar: As soon as you enter the roundabout.
Just before you leave the roundabout.

feedback.metin: If you want to leave the roundabout at the first exit, then you indicate to the right before entering the roundabout. In this way, the other traffic knows where you want to go and they can react to it. This improves traffic flow.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: As the sign indicates, you are in a parking prohibition zone. In this zone, you may only park in the spaces indicated, or in car parks or parking lanes. This is prohibited in all other areas. You are not allowed to park here. Stopping to load or unload goods, or to pick up or drop off passengers, is allowed.

sorular.soru: Should you expect moped riders from the right?

feedback.metin: The C-4 sign indicates a one-way street and is placed at T-junctions. You are required to drive on the right-hand side of the road. Cyclists and moped riders are exempt from this traffic sign and may use this one-way street in both directions, which means you can expect oncoming cyclists and moped riders.

sorular.soru: What is the energy label for the most energy-efficient passenger cars?

feedback.metin: New passenger cars have an energy label. This label indicates how much energy they use and what their CO2 emissions are. Label A is the most economical and label G the least economical.

sorular.soru: Up to what height should a child be transported in a child seat?
cevaplar: Up to a height of 1.15 metres.
Up to a height of 1.25 metres.
Up to a height of 1.35 metres.
sorular.dogruCevap: Up to a height of 1.35 metres.

feedback.metin: Children up to a height of 1.35 metres must be transported with a child car seat in the front as well as in the back.

sorular.soru: Are you driving well here?

feedback.metin: You are riding too close to the parked car. You should expect that the driver wants to get out. Therefore, you should keep at least a door width away, in case the driver has not seen you and suddenly opens his door.

sorular.soru: Where on the window do you have to hit with the safety hammer to break it?
cevaplar: In the middle of the window.
In the corner of the window.
It does not make a difference.
sorular.dogruCevap: In the corner of the window.

feedback.metin: If you need to break a side window because the doors or windows will not open anymore, you do this with the safety hammer in the corner of the side window. This way, the side window breaks the fastest.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to reverse here?

feedback.metin: Sign D-4 (compulsory direction of travel) indicates that you are not allowed to turn right here. You may simply turn or reverse here. This sign is often confused with sign C-3: one-way street.

sorular.soru: Does a police car with only blue flashing lights have priority?

feedback.metin: Only if a police car uses both blue optical signals (flashing light) and sound signals (siren) will it fall under the emergency (priority) vehicles. If they only use blue flashing lights, normal priority rules still apply.

sorular.soru: Is theft always covered by car insurance?

feedback.metin: Not all insurance policies pay out in the event of theft. If you only have third-party insurance, insurance will not pay out in the event of damage to or theft of your vehicle. If you have a limited hull or full hull (all-risk) insurance, insurance will pay out in the event of theft under certain conditions.

sorular.soru: Does the stopping distance increase when it rains?

feedback.metin: Stopping distance consists of thinking distance and braking distance. When it rains, the road surface becomes slippery and braking distance becomes longer. If the braking distance is longer, the stopping distance is also greater. It is therefore important to maintain an increased following distance and reduce your speed in bad weather conditions.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here at noon?

feedback.metin: The signs indicate that you are on a motorway. On motorways, between 6:00 AM and 7:00 PM there is a speed limit of 100 km/h.

sorular.soru: Should you apply for a new vehicle registration certificate if you have a gas installation installed?

feedback.metin: Your vehicle must correspond to the information in the vehicle registration certificate. For example, if you make changes to the type of fuel, you must have the vehicle retested and apply for a new vehicle registration certificate.

sorular.soru: What do you do when it suddenly starts snowing during a daytime drive?
cevaplar: You turn on your rear fog light.
You turn on your full-beam headlights.

feedback.metin: If you are suddenly caught in a snow shower while driving, the first thing you do is slow down. Make sure you have turned on the correct lighting: your dipped headlights. Full-beam headlights are not allowed during the day. Rear fog lights should only be switched on when visibility is less than 50 metres. This is not so likely to be the case in snow, so do not switch these on immediately.

sorular.soru: In which scenario does the motorcyclist have right of way?

feedback.metin: Regardless of whether the motorcyclist leaves the road by turning right or stays on it by turning left, you must give right of way to them as they are on a divergent priority road. While it appears that the motorcyclist is approaching the car on the same road, they are actually considered a crossing driver on the intersecting road.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in the correct lane?

feedback.metin: This lane can only be used by bus drivers, so you cannot drive here.

sorular.soru: What do you do when the windscreen washer fluid runs out?
cevaplar: Refill the fluid at the next opportunity.
Refill when you are back home.
sorular.dogruCevap: Refill the fluid at the next opportunity.

feedback.metin: When you run out of windscreen washer fluid while driving, it is important that it is refilled as soon as possible. This fluid is available at every manned petrol station, a DIY store and some supermarkets. It is not necessary to call the breakdown service because you can resolve this yourself.

sorular.soru: Should you participate in a saliva test?

feedback.metin: If an authorised person, such as a police officer, stops you, you are required to cooperate in a saliva test to detect drugs. This also applies if you have not taken any drugs. If you refuse to take part in a saliva test or blood test, the police are required to suspend your driving licence.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: Parking on a priority road outside built-up areas is not allowed. Parking on the verge of a priority road outside built-up areas is allowed, however. Inside built-up areas, parking is allowed. You can see that you are outside a built-up area because the priority sign is situated after the intersection. Within built-up areas, these signs are always situated before the intersection.

sorular.soru: Must the first vehicle of a military convoy have a green flag?

feedback.metin: The first vehicle must have a blue flag on the left-hand side. The second to penultimate vehicle has no mandatory flags, but may carry a blue flag on the left-hand side. The last vehicle must have a green flag on the left-hand side.

sorular.soru: Can you reverse out of here?
cevaplar: Yes, you can reverse but you cannot turn.
No, you cannot turn or reverse.
No, you can turn but you cannot reverse.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, you cannot turn or reverse.

feedback.metin: Turning or reversing on a motorway or autoweg is prohibited. This also applies to the approach road before the motorway.

sorular.soru: Can you drive with a 3 metre wide load?

feedback.metin: An indivisible load on a trailer may not be more than 3 metres wide. If the load protrudes more than 10 cm from the side of the trailer, it must be marked with a red and white striped marking plate.

sorular.soru: What does this dashboard symbol warn you of?

feedback.metin: This symbol warns against low oil pressure. Park your vehicle as soon as possible along the side of the road in a safe place. Call the garage or breakdown service. Driving at too low an oil pressure causes serious damage to your engine.

sorular.soru: The weather is sunny. Should you use your lights here?

feedback.metin: In wooded areas, you can be hindered by the sun's glare through the tree branches in sunny weather. This impacts your visibility as well as making it difficult for other traffic to see you. The use of dipped headlights is mandatory here.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here?

feedback.metin: Drivers are not allowed to drive faster than 15 km/h within an erf. Drivers must take into account pedestrians and children playing.

sorular.soru: What kind of lighting should you use here?

feedback.metin: If you are driving in a tunnel, you must use dipped headlights. You must switch on the dipped headlights well before you enter the tunnel.

sorular.soru: Can you use hazard lights here?

feedback.metin: If you come to a standstill on the carriageway due to a breakdown and pose a possible danger to others, you should use a warning triangle. This may be replaced by or supplemented with hazard lights.

sorular.soru: Are you overtaking correctly?

feedback.metin: When overtaking a horse rider, you should maintain as much lateral distance as possible. You should also overtake as quietly as possible. Never use the horn as this may frighten the horse.

sorular.soru: Can you park like this for a short amount of time?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park your vehicle on the road next to another vehicle; this is referred to as double parking. You may, however, briefly stop to load or unload goods or to pick up or drop off passengers. These are not categorised as parking.

sorular.soru: Should you stop here?

feedback.metin: The military convoy is approaching a red traffic light. Because the front vehicle of the convoy is approaching this traffic light, the whole military convoy has to stop. In this case, you do not have to give priority to the convoy. You only have to give priority to the convoy if the first vehicle crossed at a green light.

sorular.soru: When should you exit a vehicle that is becoming submerged in water?

feedback.metin: If your vehicle is in a body of water, you should attempt to exit as soon as possible. Remove your seat belt and try to escape through the side window. If you cannot open the window, break one of the windows with the emergency hammer. There is no need to wait until the vehicle is fully submerged. If possible, exit the vehicle through a window.

sorular.soru: Does stopping distance increase when you drive with a trailer?

feedback.metin: Driving a car with a trailer means taking into account an increased weight when braking. More weight means a longer stopping distance, regardless of whether the trailer itself is braked or not. Maintain an increased following distance between you and the vehicle in front of you to account for a longer stopped distance.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: If you want to exit the roundabout, you must give way to all traffic continuing around the roundabout.

sorular.soru: What speed difference should you take into account?

feedback.metin: Brommobielen are allowed to drive at a maximum of 45 km/h. As the driver of a passenger car, you can drive at a maximum of 50 km/h in built-up areas. The difference in speed you have to take into account is therefore 5 km/h.

sorular.soru: Can you drive with a damaged driving licence?

feedback.metin: You may only drive a car if you have a valid, original, and undamaged driving licence in your possession.

sorular.soru: Can you drive with this cargo which is protruding 1.5 metres?
cevaplar: No. Cargo may never protrude from the rear.
No. Cargo should never protrude more than 1 metre from the rear.
Yes. But only if a marking plate is used.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But only if a marking plate is used.

feedback.metin: A divisible load should never protrude more than 1 metre at the rear. An indivisible load may protrude more than 1 metre. The maximum protrusion is half the length of the trailer itself, with a maximum of 5 metres, measured from the heart of the rear axle. When cargo protrudes more than 1 metre, a marking plate is mandatory.

sorular.soru: Is driving with a tread depth of 1.5mm in the main grooves allowed?

feedback.metin: Tyres must have a minimum tread depth of 1.6mm in the main grooves. Sufficient tread depth ensures adequate water drainage, which reduces the risk of aquaplaning.

sorular.soru: Which rules of conduct should the rider of a speed pedelec follow?

feedback.metin: Speed pedelecs are electric bicycles with pedal assistance, of which the driving force is maintained when the vehicle is travelling faster than 25 km/h. This is different from a standard electric bicycle for which the driving force stops at 25 km/h. A speed pedelec has to follow the traffic rules applicable to mopeds.
